conclusion: The problem involves calculating the total displacement of a car passing through an ETC lane, involving phases of deceleration, constant speed, and acceleration.
Initial velocity v₀ = 30 m/s, final velocity v₁ = 5 m/s, deceleration a = -1 m/s², and the car ends deceleration 10 m before the toll booth centerline.
The time it takes to decelerate t₁ = 25 seconds.
The displacement during deceleration d₁ = 437.5 meters.
The car travels at constant speed v₁ = 5 m/s from 10 m before the centerline to the centerline itself.
The displacement during the constant speed phase d₂ = 10 meters.
For the acceleration phase, initial velocity v₁ = 5 m/s, final velocity v₀ = 30 m/s, and acceleration a = 1 m/s².
The time needed for acceleration t₃ = 25 seconds.
The displacement during acceleration d₃ = 437.5 meters.
